<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ignore_sigpipe:
```c
static void
ignore_sigpipe (void)
{
  struct sigaction oldsig;
  struct sigaction sig;

  sig.sa_handler = &catcher;
  sigemptyset (&sig.sa_mask);
#ifdef SA_INTERRUPT
  sig.sa_flags = SA_INTERRUPT;  /* SunOS */
#else
  sig.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
#endif
  if (0 != sigaction (SIGPIPE, &sig, &oldsig))
    fprintf (stderr,
             "Failed to install SIGPIPE handler: %s\n", strerror (errno));
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c

ignore_sigpipe (void)
{
  struct sigaction oldsig;
  struct sigaction sig;

  sig.sa_handler = &catcher;
  sigemptyset (&sig.sa_mask);
#ifdef SA_INTERRUPT
  sig.sa_flags = SA_INTERRUPT;  /* SunOS */
#else
  sig.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;

  if (0 != sigaction (SIGPIPE, &sig, &oldsig))

```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No unreachable code is present in this function. All statements in ignore_sigpipe can be executed: either SA_INTERRUPT or SA_RESTART is compiled in (mutually exclusive by the preprocessor), sig.sa_handler and sigemptyset are executed, sigaction is called, and the fprintf is reachable when sigaction returns a non‑zero error. Conditional compilation does not create unreachable code at runtime. (Note: a build/link error or an unused symbol elsewhere is not the same as unreachable code within this function.)
